UpdateRoot.testTitle: Time-Based Arrival Sequencing Optimization (ARRIVAL flight phase with valid time-to-threshold)
UpdateRoot.testObjective:
This test verifies that SKYRADAR only adjusts arrival sequence positions when the track is in ARRIVAL flight phase with valid time-to-threshold prediction.
Conditions for automatic arrival sequence adjustment are:
1) The AMAN (Arrival Manager) system status is equal to OPERATIONAL.
2) The track is in ARRIVAL flight phase with valid time-to-threshold prediction.
3) The track is located within the Extended Terminal Maneuvering Area (E-TMA) boundary.
4) The calculated arrival delay is greater than CSP: AMAN_MIN_DELAY_THRESHOLD (120 seconds).
5) The track has an assigned arrival runway with active AMAN sequencing enabled.
6) The potential sequence position change would not violate minimum time-based separation (VSP: TBS_MIN_SEPARATION_TIME = 90 seconds).
- 1st step: Track in CRUISE phase, sequence adjustment should NOT occur.
- 2nd step: Track transitions to ARRIVAL phase with valid time-to-threshold, sequence adjustment SHOULD occur.
- 3rd step: Time-to-threshold becomes invalid, sequence adjustment should NOT occur.
CSP: AMAN_MIN_DELAY_THRESHOLD=120 seconds. VSP: TBS_MIN_SEPARATION_TIME=90 seconds.
All conditions except C2 are met for automatic sequence adjustment.
UpdateRoot.actionComment: Track AFR205 transitions through flight phases with varying time-to-threshold validity to test condition C2.
UpdateRoot.actionDescription: Track is configured with all conditions satisfied except flight phase and time-to-threshold validity. Phase transitions test whether sequence adjustment depends on ARRIVAL phase with valid prediction.
